alert.note: Alert for Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 3:15PM EDT until May 06 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Virginia, including the following county: Highland. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 313 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monterey... Vanderpool... Mustoe... Mcdowell... Clover Creek... Hightown... Sirons Mill... Possum Trot... Liberty... New Hampden... Mill Gap... Blue Grass... Doe Hill... Head Waters... Williamsville... Bolar... Palo Alto... - Please visit https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety information.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
